full_title_en: Subaxial Injury Classification and Severity Scale (SLICS)
medium_description_en: Classifies subaxial cervical spine injury and provides treatment recommendations.
instructions_en: May be used with x-ray or MRI.

seo.meta_description_en: The Subaxial Injury Classification (SLIC) and Severity Score classifies the severity of subaxial cervical spine injury.
seo.keywords_en: SLIC, subaxial injury classification, subaxial injury, subaxial severity, subaxial cervical spine injury, cervical spine injury, spine injury

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: MRI may show signal change in minor injuries and can lead to over-reporting of injuries (worse scores).

next_steps.advice_en: The decision for operative vs non-operative treatment in equivocal cases (i.e., SLICS = 4) should be based on clinician judgment, with shared decisionmaking as appropriate.

creator_info.about_en: Alpesh A. Patel, MD, FACS, is a professor of orthopaedic surgery at Feinberg School of Medicine, Northwestern University. He is also the director of orthopaedic spine surgery at Northwestern University. Dr. Patel’s research focuses primarily on cervical spine surgery, minimally invasive spine surgery, motion preserving spine surgery, and disc replacement.
